text: A few people asked me why I'm moving a bunch of money into commercial real estate when I'm a trader. I've essentially spent most of my life developing my skillset to trade. And guess what? It's a fucking math problem. I can do really well in these commercial real estate deals. I still will continue to trade for sure. However, it's so important to not get attached to the craft itself and understand what is the purpose of the craft, which is to make money. So that is what I'm focused on. Where can I make the most money and reduce risk? Because here's another thing. I never know when my skill set in trading is going to be phased out by something. So to me to think that I'm going to be able to bank off of that for the next hopefully, 60 years is pretty naive. You've got to build some redundancies in this system once you create some wealth. Be an out-of-the-art see-all later.

metadata.title: REDUNDANCY #investing #optionstrading #stockmarket

▬ ABOUT ERIK  ▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran, options trader, and investor. I started trading in 2007 and have spent over 30,000 hours honing my skillset. I’ve no secret tricks or "easy money" strategies. However, I carefully studied, created strategies, tracked results, and optimized my performance. I became a multi-millionaire before 32 as a result. I actively trade derivatives and invest in residential and commercial real estate as well as startups. My goal is to share quality information without the BS.

The Outlier Community is built to connect you with other driven people who are pursuing or have achieved financial outlier status. We get together to capitalize on the hive mind to share ideas, explore stock market news, cover investing basics, options trading, portfolio management, investing psychology, strategy, money management, live trading ideas, workshops, and more. None of us find success solely on our own - here we create it together. Welcome to the Outliers!

I am not a financial advisor. All content is shared for educational and entertainment purposes only.
